intro: Homeria virgata, commonly known as the slender homeria, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
